褟字的基本解释

褟
tā
贴身的衣衫：汗褟儿。
在衣边上缝（花边）：褟花边儿。
姓。

褟字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tā］
［《玉篇》丁塔切］
亦作“1”。
(1)贴身的单衫。
(2)在衣物上缝缀花边。
(3)姓。明有褟元祖，见《明史·潘蕃传》。

褟字的康熙字典解释

【申集下】【衣字部】　褟； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1121第36
【玉篇】丁塔切，音答。衣也。

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
褟字的起名意思

暂无。

Yin
Basic explanation of words
Yin
tā
Close-fitting clothes: sweaty.
Sew on the edge of the garment (lace): quilted lace.
name.
Yin
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tā］
["Jade Pian" Tinta Chee]
Also known as "1".
(1) A close-fitting single shirt.
(2) Stitch lace on clothing.
(3) Last name. The Ming Dynasty has the Yuan ancestor, see "The History of the Ming Dynasty·Pan Fan Biography".
Yin

[Shen Jixia] [Department of Clothing Characters] 　褟; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1121 Page 36
[Jade articles] Ding Taqie, answer in sound. Clothes also.
